thread.title: Skywatchers, keep an eye out for the spectacular Draconid meteor showers on Oct 8 and 9
thread.title_full: Skywatchers, keep an eye out for the spectacular Draconid meteor showers on Oct 8 and 9 | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis

author: dna webdesk
title: Skywatchers, keep an eye out for the spectacular Draconid meteor showers on Oct 8 and 9
text:
Wikimedia Commons Sky-watchers will be in for a treat as the annual Draconid meteor shower peaks overnight on Thursday and Friday (October 8 and 9), reports Space.com. According to NASA, on an average, 10 to 20 meteors will be visible per hour during the Draconids.
The meteor display is caused by the remains of a comet raining down on earth. The shower originates from the constellation Draco in the far northern sky. Incidentally, the term Draco is Latin for dragon and was the name of Harry Potter’s arch-nemesis Draco Malfoy in JK Rowling’s books.
